results.headline: India's 300-Year Old AI Lesson
results.summary: The nation’s outsourcing dominance may go the same way as its textile industry, which lost out to automation during the first industrial revolution.

results.headline: TSMC and Foxconn Will Guide the Global Supply Chain
results.summary: As TSMC and Foxconn expand their footprints across the world, other players will need to follow.

results.authors: By Vince Golle and Molly Smith
results.headline: World Economy Latest: ECB Cuts Rates, US Payrolls Surge
results.summary: The European Central Bank delivered the interest-rate reduction it’s been flagging for months — moving away from a record high — but stopped short of indicating more cuts may follow.

results.headline: PC Maker Raspberry Pi Seen Pricing IPO at Top End of Range
results.summary: British personal computer maker Raspberry Pi expects to price its London initial public offering at the top end of its range, according to terms seen by Bloomberg.

results.headline: TSMC’s May Sales Rise 30% as Countries Race to Secure AI Chips
results.summary: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co.’s May sales rose 30% to NT$229.6 billion ($7.1 billion), helped by booming demand for artificial intelligence and a recovery in some consumer electronics.

results.headline: China’s Exports Surge More Than Expected in Economic Boost
results.summary: China’s exports climbed more than expected in May, boosting hopes that the world’s second-biggest economy can maintain its momentum by relying on foreign markets even in the face of new tariff threats.

results.headline: Samsung Union Goes on First-Ever Strike Over Pay Dispute
results.summary: The largest union at Samsung Electronics Co. went on a strike for the first time in the company’s 55-year history, with the standoff over pay so entrenched that the two sides have stopped all discussions.

results.authors: By Leah Nylen and Ian King
results.headline: Microsoft, Nvidia to Face US Antitrust Probes Over AI Moves
results.summary: The US is opening antitrust investigations into two of the world’s most valuable companies, Microsoft Corp. and Nvidia Corp., over their dominance of the rapidly emerging field of artificial intelligence, according to people familiar with the matter.

results.headline: ASML Has Another 35% Upside After Hitting Record High, BofA Says
results.summary: Hot on the heels of becoming Europe’s second-largest company by market value, ASML Holding NV got a fresh boost as Bank of America Corp. raised its price target to a level above all peers.

results.authors: By Vlad Savov, Jane Lanhee Lee, and Takashi Mochizuki
results.headline: Nvidia’s Rise to $3 Trillion Fuels ‘Jensanity’ in Tech World
results.summary: Jensen Huang wasn’t on the official Computex 2024 program, but he didn’t need to be.
